珬字的基本解释

珬
xù
与珂极为相似的一种玉：“致远流离与珂珬。”

珬字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xù］
［《廣韻》辛聿切，入術，心。］
玉名。

珬字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【玉字部】　珬； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页731第17
【廣韻】辛律切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】雪律切，?音卹。【廣韻】珂屬。【集韻】珂謂之珬。【左思·吳都賦】致遠流離與珂珬。【註】劉達曰：老雕入海所化。　【類篇】或作㺷。

珬字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
珬字的起名意思

与珂极为相似的一种玉。

Wat
Basic explanation of words
Wat
xù
A kind of jade that is very similar to Ke: "Zhi Yuanliu and Ke Hu."
Wat
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［xù］
["Guang Yun" Xin Yu cut, into the operation, the heart. ]
Jade name.
Wat
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Won Collection 1] [Jade Character Department] 　珬; Kangxi Strokes: 11; Page Number: Page 731 17
[Guang Yun] Xin Luqie [Ji Yun] [Yunhui] [Zheng Yun] Xue Luqie, a shirt. [Guang Yun] Ke belongs to. [Jiyun] Ke is called the wat. 【Zuo Si·Wu Du Fu】Zhi Yuan Lili and Ke Hu. [Note] Liu Da said: The old eagle was transformed into the sea.　【Classification】Or make 㺷.
